Section.Text: This Part prescribes components of explosives for the purpose of the definition restricted component in section 2 of the Explosives Act, restricts the acquisition and sale of those components and sets out the requirements for their sale and storage.
The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: component seller means a person who is included on the component sellers list.
component sellers list means the list of component sellers that is compiled by the Chief Inspector of Explosives under subsection 462(1).
product seller means a person who is included on the product sellers list.
product sellers list means the list of product sellers that is compiled by the Chief Inspector of Explosives under subsection 463(1).
restricted component product means a product, other than an *explosive, that contains or is made from a restricted component.
sell includes offer for sale.

Footnote.Text: Terms preceded by an asterisk are defined in section 6.

Subsection.Text: The following components are prescribed for the purpose of the definition restricted component in section 2 of the Explosives Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ammonium nitrate in solid form at a concentration of at least 28% nitrogen;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: hydrogen peroxide at a concentration of at least 30%;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: nitromethane, UN number 1261;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: potassium chlorate, UN number 1485;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: potassium perchlorate, UN number 1489;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: sodium chlorate in solid form, UN number 1495;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: nitric acid at a concentration of at least 75%;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: potassium nitrate, UN number 1486;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: potassium nitrate and sodium nitrate mixture, UN number 1499; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: sodium nitrate in solid form, UN number 1498.

Subsection.Text: The components set out in subsection (1) may be sold only by a person who is authorized by this Part to sell restricted components.

The components set out in subsection (1) may be acquired for the purpose of manufacturing restricted component products for sale only by a person who is authorized by this Part to acquire restricted components for that purpose.
Any person may sell a restricted component for use in a laboratory that is part of or affiliated with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a post-secondary educational institution recognized by a province;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a hospital or health clinic; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a government or law enforcement agency.

Subsection.Text: A component seller may sell a restricted component. A component seller who acquires a restricted component for sale must comply with this Part.

Section.Text: A product seller may acquire a restricted component for the purpose of manufacturing restricted component products for sale. A product seller who acquires a restricted component must comply with this Part.
Any person may acquire a restricted component for a purpose other than manufacturing restricted component products for sale.

Heading.TitleText: Component Sellers and Product Sellers Lists

Subsection.Text: An applicant for inclusion on the component sellers list must complete, sign and send to the Chief Inspector of Explosives the application form provided by the Department of Natural Resources. The application must include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s name, address, telephone number, fax number and email address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the restricted components to be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the address of each location where a restricted component will be stored or sold and the storage capacity or anticipated annual sales volume, as the case may be, for each component at each location; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address, telephone number, fax number and email address of a contact person for each location where a restricted component will be stored or sold.

Subsection.Text: If ammonium nitrate is to be sold, the application must also include a declaration that a security plan has been prepared for each location where ammonium nitrate will be stored or sold. The plan must include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the emergency procedures to be followed in responding to all risk events, including security-related events, and an indication of the title of the person who will be responsible for ensuring that each procedure is followed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the measures to be taken to control access to the ammonium nitrate, including control of keys;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the measures to be taken to control access to sales records;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the stock management system to be implemented and the title of the person who will be responsible for carrying out weekly inspections of the stock; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the measures to be taken to ensure that the sale of ammonium nitrate will be refused if the quantity requested is not proportional to the buyer’s needs or if the component seller or their employee has reasonable grounds to suspect that the ammonium nitrate will be used for a criminal purpose.

Subsection.Text: An applicant for inclusion on the product sellers list must complete, sign and send to the Chief Inspector of Explosives the application form provided by the Department of Natural Resources. The application must include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s name, address, telephone number, fax number and email address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the *product name of each restricted component product to be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the restricted components that will be used in manufacturing the products;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the address of each location where a restricted component will be stored and the storage capacity for each component at each location; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address, telephone number, fax number and email address of a contact person for each location where a restricted component will be stored.

Subsection.Text: If ammonium nitrate is to be stored, the application must include a declaration that a security plan has been prepared for each location where ammonium nitrate will be stored. The plan must include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the emergency procedures to be followed in responding to all risk events, including security-related events, and an indication of the title of the person who will be responsible for ensuring that each procedure is followed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the measures to be taken to control access to the ammonium nitrate, including control of keys; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the stock management system to be implemented and the title of the person who will be responsible for carrying out weekly inspections of the stock.

Footnote.Text: Terms preceded by an asterisk are defined in section 6.

Subsection.Text: If an applicant provides the information required by section 460, the Chief Inspector of Explosives must include their name on the component sellers list, assign them a number and provide them with a document that certifies the number and effective date of listing.
A listing is effective for five years after the date that is set out in the document.

If an applicant provides the information required by section 461, the Chief Inspector of Explosives must include their name on the product sellers list, assign them a number and provide them with a document that sets out the number and effective date of listing.
A listing is effective for five years after the date that is set out in the document.

Section.Text: Every component seller and product seller must provide the Chief Inspector of Explosives with a written notice of any change to the information provided in an application within 10 days after the date of the change.

Heading.TitleText: Rules for Component Sellers and Product Sellers
Restricted Components Other Than Ammonium Nitrate

Section.Text: Sections 466 to 476 apply to all restricted components except ammonium nitrate.

Section.MarginalNote: Responsibilities of component seller and product seller
Section.Text: Every component seller must ensure that the requirements of sections 467 to 476 are met at each location where they store or sell a restricted component. Every product seller must ensure that the requirements of sections 467 to 471 are met at each location where they store a restricted component.
A restricted component may only be stored in or sold from a location that has been disclosed in an application or in a notice of change referred to in section 464.

Subsection.Text: A restricted component must be locked up when it is not *attended.
A sign that warns against unauthorized access must be posted on the outside at each entrance to each location where a restricted component is stored.
Access to a restricted component must be limited to people authorized by the component seller or product seller, as the case may be.

Footnote.Text: Terms preceded by an asterisk are defined in section 6.

Section.Text: A list of the employees who work at each location where a restricted component is stored or sold must be kept at the location.

Subsection.Text: A stock management system must be put in place to account for all restricted components that are under the control of the component seller or product seller.

Weekly inspections of the restricted components must be carried out. A record of the results of each inspection, including any loss or tampering and the cause of any loss that is not attributable to normal operations, must be kept for two years after the date on which the record is made.

Section.Text: If any theft or attempted theft of, or any tampering with, a restricted component is discovered,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the local police force must be informed immediately;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Chief Inspector of Explosives must be informed within 24 hours after the discovery; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a written report of the incident must be submitted to the Chief Inspector as soon as the circumstances permit.

Subsection.Text: The sale of a restricted component must be refused if the seller has reasonable grounds to suspect that the component will be used for a criminal purpose.

Every refusal to sell a restricted component as a result of complying with subsection (1) or section 476 must, within 24 hours after the refusal, be reported to the Chief Inspector of Explosives and to the local police force.

Section.Text: Before a restricted component is sold, the buyer must be required to establish their identity by providing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the buyer intends to use the component to manufacture an explosive and a licence or certificate is required for this purpose, the number of the buyer’s licence or certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the buyer intends to sell the component, proof that the buyer is included on the component sellers list; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in all other cases,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a piece of identification, issued by the Government of Canada or a provincial, municipal or foreign government, that bears a photograph of the buyer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: two pieces of identification, each of which sets out the buyer’s name, at least one of which is issued by the Government of Canada or a provincial, municipal or foreign government and at least one of which sets out the buyer’s address,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the buyer’s provincial pesticide licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: proof of the buyer’s Canadian Wheat Board identification number,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: proof of the buyer’s Producteur Agricole number,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: proof of the buyer’s Ontario Federation of Agriculture number,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the buyer’s business licence or proof of the buyer’s corporate registration, or

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: proof of the buyer’s registration under the Controlled Goods Regulations.

Section.Text: A restricted component may be sold to a buyer who is unable to establish their identity in accordance with section 473 if another component seller confirms in writing that they have been provided with the identification required for that buyer. The confirmation must set out the type of document provided to the other component seller and its reference number.

Subsection.Text: A record of each sale of a restricted component must be kept for two years after the date of the sale. The record must include the following information and documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the buyer’s name, address and telephone number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the sale;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the bill of lading, sales receipt or similar document;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the type of document provided under section 473 and the document’s reference number;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the *product name and quantity of the component sold;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether the component was sold in bulk or in packages;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the component was sold in packages, the weight or volume of each package;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a description of how the component will be used; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: if the component was shipped, the date of reception and the quantity received.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a component seller who has entered into an annual sales contract with a buyer, the information required under paragraphs (1)(d) and (h) need only be recorded once in each calendar year.
The record of sale must be kept locked up when it is not being used and must be made available only to a person who needs access to it in the course of their employment.
This section does not apply to a sale of the following restricted components if the quantity sold is no more than the quantity set out below:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: hydrogen peroxide, 1 L;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: nitromethane, 1 L;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: potassium chlorate, 1 kg;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: potassium perchlorate, 10 kg;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: sodium chlorate, 1 kg;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: nitric acid, 4 L;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: potassium nitrate, 25 kg; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: sodium nitrate, 25 kg.

Subsection.Note: Note: This exception for small sales of restricted components applies only to the requirement to keep records of sales.

Footnote.Text: Terms preceded by an asterisk are defined in section 6.

Section.Text: An employee of a component seller must not sell a restricted component if they have reasonable grounds to suspect that the component will be used for a criminal purpose.
Sections 478 to 495 apply to ammonium nitrate.

Section.MarginalNote: Responsibilities of component seller and product seller
Section.Text: Every component seller must ensure that the requirements of sections 479 to 495 are met at each location where they store or sell ammonium nitrate. Every product seller must ensure that the requirements of sections 479 to 488 are met at each location where they store ammonium nitrate.
Ammonium nitrate may only be stored at or sold from a location that has been disclosed in an application or in a notice of change referred to in section 464.
The local police force must be informed in writing of all locations where ammonium nitrate is to be stored or sold.

Subsection.Text: Any structure that contains ammonium nitrate and every door, window or other point of access to a building in which ammonium nitrate is stored must be locked when the ammonium nitrate is not *attended.
A key control plan must be prepared in writing and implemented.
All main entrances to a building in which ammonium nitrate is stored must be lit at all times outside business hours.

Footnote.Text: Terms preceded by an asterisk are defined in section 6.

Section.Text: The security plan of the component seller or the product seller, as the case may be, must be implemented and must be updated every 12 months.

Subsection.Text: A sign that warns against unauthorized access must be posted on the outside at each entrance to each location where ammonium nitrate is stored.
Access to ammonium nitrate must be limited to people authorized by the component seller or product seller.

Section.Text: A list of the employees who work at each location where ammonium nitrate is stored or sold must be kept at the location.
When ammonium nitrate is received,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of ammonium nitrate that is received must be compared with the quantity that is recorded on the bill of lading;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any signs of tampering with the vehicle or rail car in which the ammonium nitrate is shipped and any signs of attempted theft must be recorded, and the record must be kept for two years after the date on which it is made;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person from whom the ammonium nitrate was bought must be informed of any signs of tampering or attempted theft and of any loss that is not attributable to normal operations; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the cause of any loss of ammonium nitrate that is not attributable to normal operations must be recorded, and the record must be kept for two years after the date on which it is made.

Subsection.Text: A stock management system must be put in place to account for all ammonium nitrate that is under the control of the component seller or product seller.
An annual inventory audit of the ammonium nitrate must be performed.

Weekly inspections of the ammonium nitrate must be carried out. A record of the results of each inspection, including any loss or tampering and the cause of any loss that is not attributable to normal operations, must be kept for two years after the record is made.

Section.Text: For each calendar year, an inventory must be submitted to the Chief Inspector of Explosives in the form provided by the Department of Natural Resources. The inventory must be submitted no later than March 31 of the year following the year of the inventory and must include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the listing number of the component seller or product seller;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a record of the ammonium nitrate that sets out, for each location where ammonium nitrate is stored or sold,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the starting inventory,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of ammonium nitrate that was manufactured,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of ammonium nitrate that was acquired and the manner of acquisition;

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of ammonium nitrate that was used, sold, exported, destroyed, stolen or lost, as the case may be,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the year-end inventory, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the historical normal range of loss that is due to loss of water or mechanical abrasion; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address, telephone number, fax number and email address of the person who completed the form.

Section.Text: If any theft or attempted theft of, or tampering with, ammonium nitrate is discovered,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the local police force must be informed immediately; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a written report of the incident must be submitted to the Chief Inspector of Explosives within 24 hours after the discovery.

Subsection.Text: A sale of ammonium nitrate must be refused if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity requested is not proportional to the buyer’s needs; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the component seller or their employee has reasonable grounds to suspect that the ammonium nitrate will be used for a criminal purpose.

Subsection.Text: Every refusal to sell ammonium nitrate as a result of complying with subsection (1) or section 495 must, within 24 hours after the refusal, be reported to the Chief Inspector of Explosives and to the local police force.

Section.Text: Before ammonium nitrate is sold, the buyer must be required to establish their identity by providing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the buyer intends to use the ammonium nitrate to manufacture an explosive and a licence or certificate is required for this purpose, the number of the buyer’s licence or certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the buyer intends to sell the ammonium nitrate, proof that the buyer is included on the component sellers list; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in all other cases,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a piece of identification, issued by the Government of Canada or a provincial, municipal or foreign government, that bears a photograph of the buyer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: two pieces of identification, each of which sets out the buyer’s name, at least one of which is issued by the Government of Canada or a provincial, municipal or foreign government and at least one of which sets out the buyer’s address,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: proof of the buyer’s provincial pesticide licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: proof of the buyer’s Canadian Wheat Board identification number,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: proof of the buyer’s Producteur Agricole number,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: proof of the buyer’s Ontario Federation of Agriculture number, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: proof of the buyer’s registration under the Controlled Goods Regulations.

Section.Text: Ammonium nitrate may be sold to a buyer who is unable to establish their identity in accordance with section 490 if another component seller confirms in writing that they have been provided with the identification required for that buyer. The confirmation must set out the type of document provided to the other component seller and its reference number.

Subsection.Text: A record of each sale of ammonium nitrate must be kept for two years after the date of the sale. The record must include the following information and documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the buyer’s name, address and telephone number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the sale;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the bill of lading, sales receipt or similar document;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the type of document provided under section 490 and the document’s reference number;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the *product name and quantity of the ammonium nitrate sold;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether the ammonium nitrate was sold in bulk or in packages;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the ammonium nitrate was sold in packages, the weight or volume of each package;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a description of how the ammonium nitrate will be used;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: if the ammonium nitrate was shipped, the driver’s licence number, the estimated and actual date of delivery, the address to which it is delivered and the quantity received; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: if delivery was made at the time of purchase, a receipt signed by the buyer including the information required under paragraphs (a) and (b) and (d) to (h).

Subsection.Text: In the case of a component seller who has entered into an annual sales contract with a buyer, the information required under paragraphs (1)(d) and (h) need only be recorded once in each calendar year.
The record of sale must be kept locked up when it is not being used and must be made available only to a person who needs access to it in the course of their employment.
This section does not apply if the quantity of ammonium nitrate sold is 1 kg or less.
Subsection.Note: Note: This exception for small sales of ammonium nitrate applies only to the requirement to keep a record of sale.

Footnote.Text: Terms preceded by an asterisk are defined in section 6.

Subsection.Text: When more than 1 kg of ammonium nitrate is shipped by vehicle,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: each access point on the portion of the vehicle containing the ammonium nitrate must be locked or sealed with a security cable immediately after the shipment is loaded; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the driver of the vehicle must be provided with a written notice stating that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the ammonium nitrate is to be *attended unless the vehicle is either parked in a secure location or the vehicle and load are locked,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the driver is to inspect all locks and, if seals are present, inspect all seals at each stop and at the final destination, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the driver must immediately report to the component seller any signs of theft, attempted theft or tampering and any loss that is not attributable to normal operations.

Subsection.Text: When ammonium nitrate is shipped by rail,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: each access point on the rail car containing the ammonium nitrate must be locked or sealed with a security cable immediately after the shipment is loaded; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a means must be in place to track the shipment on a daily basis until delivery occurs and to investigate if the shipment does not arrive at its destination.

Footnote.Text: Terms preceded by an asterisk are defined in section 6.

Section.Text: When ammonium nitrate is sold to a buyer who is not a component seller or product seller, the buyer must be provided with a written notice which states that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: security measures are to be taken to prevent the theft of ammonium nitrate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any sign of theft, attempted theft or tampering and any loss that is not attributable to normal operations must be immediately reported to the local police force; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the resale of ammonium nitrate is prohibited.

Section.Text: An employee of a component seller must refuse to sell ammonium nitrate if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity requested is not proportional to the buyer’s needs; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the employee has reasonable grounds to suspect that the ammonium nitrate will be used for a criminal purpose.

Subsection.Text: If a component seller or product seller fails to comply with the Explosives Act or these Regulations, the Chief Inspector of Explosives may suspend them from the component sellers list or product sellers list. The suspension continues until the component seller or product seller remedies the failure to comply.

If a component seller or product seller fails to comply with the Explosives Act or these Regulations on more than one occasion, the Chief Inspector may remove them from the component sellers list or product sellers list.

Before suspending or removing a component seller or product seller from the component sellers list or product sellers list, the Chief Inspector of Explosives must provide them with written notice of the reasons for the suspension or removal and its effective date, and give them an opportunity to provide reasons why the listing should not be suspended or cancelled.
However, a component seller or a product seller is suspended automatically and without notice if they fail to provide the annual inventory required under section 487.

Within 15 days after the date of suspension or removal from the component sellers list or product sellers list, a component seller or product seller may send the Minister a written request for review of the decision of the Chief Inspector of Explosives to suspend or remove.
The Minister must confirm, revoke or amend the decision under review.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), these Regulations come into force on February 1, 2014.
The following provisions come into force on February 1, 2015:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: paragraphs 25(i) and (j);

Paragraph.Label: (b)

Paragraph.Label: (c)
